item.title: Move Determination
item.description: 6.1 Move Determination Walkthrough After establishing the XBoard protocol, the client (white) starts a game by indicating a move. The following sequence diagram shows an example interaction at the subsystem level from the input “e2e4” (white pawn e2-e4) to DokChess’ response, which is the output “move b8c6” (black knight b8-c6, “Nimzowitsch defense”). Fig.: Sample interaction for move determination First, the Text UI subsystem validates the input with the aid of the Rules subsystem (â†’ Concept 8.
